title-group.article-title: A Survey of the History of Transit Buses in the United States

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1990 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: The paper traces the development of transit bus technology from its origins to the present day. In addition to covering technical issues such as methods of chassis and body construction, types of power plants and other components used, and general design features, the paper addresses the political, economic, and social influences that have affected the actions of bus manufacturers through the decades. Specific topics include GM's New Look bus—the design that dominated the industry for nearly 20 years; the antitrust suit brought against GM by the U.S. Justice Department in 1956; the U.S. government's Transbus program, which lasted from 1971 to 1979; and the evolution of the current industry standard, the Advanced Design Bus. The paper's appendix provides a chronological survey of design analysis methodsincluding the use of proving grounds, laboratory testing, and specific techniques such as cumulative damage analysis, finite element analysis, and fracture mechanics—that have been used in the development of transit buses.
